newsitem.title: SRI LANKA: Sri Lankan police arrest former cabinet minister.
newsitem.headline: Sri Lankan police arrest former cabinet minister.

text.p: Sri Lankan police on Monday arrested Sirisena Cooray, an influential cabinet minister of the previous United National Party (UNP) regime, his lawyer and aides said.

Cooray was detained by the Defence Ministry under emergency regulations to prevent him from acting in any manner prejudicial to national security or the maintenance of public order, his lawyer Lakshman Ranasinghe told Reuters.
"We intend filing a habeas corpus writ in Appeal Court on Tuesday," Ranasinghe said.
Cooray can be detained for a minimum of three months under emergency regulations.
The Defence Ministry spokesman was not immediately available for comment.
Cooray was minister of housing and local government and confidant of assassinated president Ranasinghe Premadasa of the UNP.
The UNP's 17 year reign ended in 1994 when the ruling People's Alliance won presidential and general elections.
Cooray returned to the island in April after a lengthy stay abroad.
